Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the World Health Organization (WHO) did not rank or compare countries' responses to Covid-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as there is no international ranking available on the WHO's website for countries' Covid-19 responses.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of votes secured by President Rajapaksa in the 2019 election is relevant to ranking the Covid-19 response.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests that Sri Lanka's response to Covid-19 is the fifth best among nations battling the pandemic, but there is no evidence or alternative explanation provided to support this ranking.
